definition: to go round and round/running around in circles/fig. frantically busy
dumpling
round/lump/ball/to roll into a ball/to gather/regiment/group/society/classifier for a lump or a soft mass: wad (of paper), ball (of wool), cloud (of smoke)
dumpling
round/lump/ball/to roll into a ball/to gather/regiment/group/society/classifier for a lump or a soft mass: wad (of paper), ball (of wool), cloud (of smoke)
see 轉文|转文[zhuai3 wen2]
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)
to fool/to dupe

sentences.english: For a long time, I watched them scurrying around the base of the tree in bewilderment.
sentences.chinese: 我观察良久，看到它们一直围着树干底部团团转。

sentences.english: By working smart you can save a ridiculous amount of time you would have otherwise been spinning your wheels.
sentences.chinese: 巧干可以为你节省大量时间而不会让你忙的团团转。

sentences.english: She bustled around in the kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 她在厨房里忙得团团转。

sentences.english: She must be nervous,she fusses about all the time.
sentences.chinese: 她想必很紧张，她一直忙碌得团团转。

sentences.english: Champions League, 1 Diego will play Inter Milan midfielder lost in a fog.
sentences.chinese: 冠军联赛上，迭戈1人将国米中场玩得团团转。

sentences.english: I'm bombarded with work every day.
sentences.chinese: 我每天都被工作围得团团转。

sentences.english: Only blame me too easily trusting, was finally getting.
sentences.chinese: 只怪我太轻易相信别人，最后被玩得团团转。

sentences.english: You are apt to be all revved up with no place to go.
sentences.chinese: 你倾向于平白无故地忙个团团转。

sentences.english: She is as busy as a bee in the morning.
sentences.chinese: 早上她总是忙得团团转。

sentences.english: Really busy round and round, a little private space at all.
sentences.chinese: 真的忙得团团转，一点私人空间都没有。

sentences.english: It is not like they are pressed for time to get these things done, as both are retired.
sentences.chinese: 他们并非每天都忙得团团转，都是退休的人了。

sentences.english: Our hostess fluttered about, taking quick nervous puffs at her cigarette.
sentences.chinese: 我们的女主人急得团团转，猛抽着烟。

sentences.english: Most women here are cynical of his about-turn.
sentences.chinese: 许多妇女被他这种玩世不恭的态度耍的团团转。

definition: confused and disoriented
to play with/to wield/to act (cool etc)/to display (a skill, one's temper etc)
surname Shua
lit. badly burned about the head (from trying to put out a fire) (idiom)/fig. hard-pressed/under pressure (from a heavy workload, creditors etc)
to play with/to engage in/to resort to/to dally with
half dead (of torment, hunger, tiredness etc)/(tired) to death/(terrified) out of one's wits/(beaten) to within an inch of one's life/(knock) the daylights out of sb
to stomp or hop about (in anxiety, anger etc)/to dance on one's feet/hopping mad (anxious, etc)
unbearable/terrible/enough/unlikely
lit. chickens flying and dogs jumping (idiom)/fig. in chaos/in disarray
busy and unable to get away
to order (sb) around/to send on an errand/to order away
to be confused and disoriented
battered and exhausted/stuck in a dilemma
tumult/uproar/commotion/disturbance
to deceive/to coax/to amuse (a child)
variant of 鬨|哄[hong4]
roar of laughter (onom.)/hubbub/to roar (as a crowd)
feet not touching the ground (idiom)/to run like the wind
confused/distracted
(like) a cat on a hot tin roof/anxious/agitated
pinyin: re4 guo1 shang5 de5 ma3 yi3
